data.prayer: Lord, please give the 947 believers in the state of Aiga-i-le-Tai the Spirit of wisdom and revelation, so that they might know you better.
data.verse: I keep asking that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the glorious Father, may give you the Spirit of wisdom and revelation, so that you may know him better.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Aiga-i-le-Tai, Samoa
data.section_summary: What people or resources could you pray for in this photo?

data.prayer: Father, please raise up new apostles to pioneer the growth of the church in Aiga-i-le-Tai.
data.verse: So Christ himself gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the pastors and teachers, to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up

data.prayer: Jesus, raise up prophets and truth speakers in your church in Aiga-i-le-Tai, Samoa so that the church can grow in every way into the mature body of you its head.
data.verse: Instead, speaking the truth in love, we will grow to become in every respect the mature body of him who is the head, that is, Christ.

data.prayer: Father, reveal your kingdom to those with a childlike heart in the state of Aiga-i-le-Tai.
data.verse: At that time, Jesus answered, “I thank you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you hid these things from the wise and understanding, and revealed them to infants. Yes, Father, for so it was well-pleasing in your sight.

data.prayer: Father, as people seek answers on the internet, please help them find the gospel in Aiga-i-le-Tai, Samoa.
data.verse: So I say to you, ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you.

data.prayer: Father, you know every soul, and you know who are yours and who are yet to be yours out of the 5,100 people living in Aiga-i-le-Tai, Samoa. Please, call your lost sheep to yourself.
data.verse: For I will take you out of the nations; I will gather you from all the countries and bring you back into your own land.

data.prayer: Father, we pray the believers are good spiritual stewards of their everyday relationships in Aiga-i-le-Tai, Samoa.
